quotes.quote: The spirit of moderation should also be the spirit of the lawgiver.
Moderation is the key of lasting enjoyment.
Moderation has been called a virtue to limit the ambition of great men, and to console undistinguished people for their want of fortune and their lack of merit.
Practice moderation in all things except love.
Moderation consists in being moved as angels are moved.
Moderation: a median with no means, praised by those with no misfortunes, practiced by those with no merits.
Moderation is a wiser policy than zealotry.
In moderating, not in satisfying desires, lies peace.
Moderation is a fatal thing. Nothing succeeds like excess.
Moderation is the inseparable companion of wisdom, but with it genius has not even a nodding acquaintance.
One can with but moderate possessions do what one ought.
Moderation is an ostentatious proof of our strength of character.
Only actions give life strength; only moderation gives it charm.
Moderation is the feebleness and sloth of the soul, whereas ambition is the warmth and activity of it.
Moderation in all things.
If moderation is a fault, then indifference is a crime.
Everything in moderation, and there's a perfect balance in this life if we can find it.
Out of moderation a pure happiness springs.
Everything in moderation, and there's a perfect balance in this life if we can find it.
Never go to excess, but let moderation be your guide.
Moderation is the secret of survival.
Only actions give life its strength, as only moderation gives it its charm.
Moderation is the center wherein all philosophies, both human and divine, meet.
Moderation is a beautiful thing when extremes, although they exist, are the exception and not the rule.
Throw moderation to the winds, and the greatest pleasures bring the greatest pains.
The boundary of man is moderation. When once we pass that pale our guardian angel quits his charge of us.
Be moderate in order to taste the joys of life in abundance.
Moderation is the silken string running through the pearl-chain of all virtues.
Moderation in temper is always a virtue; but moderation in principle is always a vice.
Moderation is actually the flip side of dieting, that is, imposed deprivation.
